titles.title: Karen Matthews Act of 2001
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide criminal penalties for the harassment of victims of Federal offenses by the convicted offenders.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 1/3/2001--Introduced. Karen Matthews Act of 2001 - Amends the Federal criminal code to prescribe criminal penalties for harassment by a person convicted of a Federal offense of the victim of that offense. Defines "harass" to include the malicious or repeated frivolous filing of legal process or liens against the person or property of the victim.
